Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: David T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a convenient location being a 25minute walk from central station or 5min cycle. Hotels cleanliness was very good, and breakfast was also good quality with a choice. Hotel prices are steep within this area but I feel this was not great value for money and would look at staying somewhere different if i was to return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “My Eurpoe Tour”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking or a train ride from all the major attraction. The hotel staff helpful with their recommendation .....

Reviews.Title: “Easter Holidays minibreak”
Reviews.Author: DAVID O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a quad room on the ground floor which was clean and comfortable, very warm and had a large TV which picked up BBC channels. Decor was a bit 70s, smoked mirrors etc but there was a large french window to an outside courtyard, so plenty of natural light. The bathroom had a bath and shower unit over the bath and was adequate although a little pungent at times. Reception staff obliged with a plug for the bath and extra milk for the tea and coffee, and were always smiley and friendly. As an earlier review states the quad room is right next to the kitchen and you feel that you are IN the kitchen when the chopping and preparing breakfast happens at circa 6.30am (this is the only downside). Breakfasts we worth the noise though - a good standard and variety of foods on offer. Location was good for walking-based expeditions, not the nicest looking street but less than 5 mins to restaurants, a Metro and only 20 mins walk back to the railway station on our departure. Must also add that we had an early train to catch on our last day and the staff assisted by allowing us to take breakfast early, which was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “OK Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Caf451
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very modern i think that was the best side of the hotel other then that there was cleaning every day but they were not dusting the rooms or anything which made the rooms so dusty and uncomfortable. The toilets were fine clean very old showers though, water pressure was great didnt want to get out the shower. Very very cheap toilet roll was not comfortable at all so hard :) 42 inch tv in double room which was quite impressing and had decent amount of channels. The hotel in general though really needs a revamp as its very old and needs some looking after. Friends single room was tiny literally made a room out of a tiny space but had a balcony which was great as you can smoke comfortably there. Had a vending machine which was useful as not very close supermarkets around. Hotel was like a 20min walk to central Dam square which was quite tiring if you walk there and go to attractions and walk back was very tiring. Hotels customer service even though we had nothing to do with the receptionist or anything they were polite and helped whenever we asked of anything.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Stephen1981
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid to stay here for one night (Â£39) I wasn't expecting much but I have to say it was absolutely prefect. Friendly staff, Clean modern rooms and excellent amenities. Will definitely be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “One Person Visit”
Reviews.Author: 517dave
Reviews.Content: Booked online via Easy jet website, booking was easy and secured with credit card, walking form centraal station i would say about 20mins approx, or you can catch a tram which stops near bye then a 5 min walk,on arrival i booked in and paid my fee in cash for 1 night 39 euros this included breakfast, i was in room 209 second floor, there is a lift also vending machine on lower floor, got to room and not bad, two single beds,shower,tea/coffee & kettle,window view & central heating and very large flat screen tv fixed to wall lot of channels in English, the room was clean but more effort would have made it even better, there was also towels soap and shampoo, i had a good nights sleep, got woke up once from the bed banging next door only lasted 5 mins (poor lad) went to breakfast at 9am there was scrambled eggs boiled eggs fruit juice coffee and tea fruit ham and cheese, i thought it was very nice and good value for the money,when i come to Amsterdam again i shall book a room here, marks out of 10 i would say 7.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lydi-2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in February and this was our 2nd stay at this hotel (first time 2008) and were very happy again. We were very happy with the hotel and our room. Staff were always welcoming and helpful. The bed and pillows were so comfy we had good sleeps. The bathroom was fine with nice toiletries and I loved the huge radiator to keep as warm or cool as you like. The rooms were relatively basic but were clean with nice furniature, big tv etc. Too be honest I have been to Amsterdam many time and stayed in many places, I personally feel that this hotel is the best value for money. It is not much more expensive than a hostel but is much better quality, for the price I think you get quite a lot. I cannot afford to stay in 5star places but personally wouldnt need to, this has everything we needed. I didnt notice the smell of smoke anywhere in the hotel which is surprising considering Amsterdam allows the smoking of cannabis and I assume many visitors come to take advantage of this. Maybe some guests don't realise its a non smoking place because 3 years ago, the hotel WAS smoke friendly. My only gripe about the hotel is when we booked through EXPEDIA, we were told that If we wanted breakfast we would need to pay an extra Â£72 for us both to eat breakfast during our stay. Of course we opted to eat else where at those costs but on arrival we were told breakfast was included! certainly pleased I didnt pay the extra. however, this is down to expedia. And thanks to the Falcon Plaza, we had breakfast when we were not expecting it. A great stay. I personally would bother looking elsewhere in future, the risks of where you end up can be too huge!

Reviews.Title: “Falcon Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Margaret F Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel within easy walking distance of main attractions. The staff were very polite and helpful. Our room was modern with plenty of space for four adults. Clean towels every day. Happily recomment this hotel to visitors of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: nellyRuncorn_England
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just a bit off the beaten track but not too far away from everything. Our room (106) wasn't huge but it was plenty big enough for the three of us, Me, my partner and our 13yr old daughter. The TV was huge and there were a lot of english channels. The beds were so comfy and the pillows were the best I've ever slept on. The staff were friendly, breakfast was continental, enough to fill you up to start the day. There is a handy supermarket 2 mins round the corner. The hotel also kept our bags in a room because we had a late flight home and wanted to do some more sight seeing. We walked back to Centraal Station, which only took about 20 mins. Got ripped off by one taxi driver coming out of the Van Gogh museum, apart from that we had a fabulous trip and would stay in the Falcon Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Tidy and Friendly and good location - its not 5*but then again you are not paying for 5*”
Reviews.Author: no1sausage
Reviews.Content: I often read reviews on here over and over for different hotels when booking a trip for hours. Pondering what to do and where to stay, worrying over every negative comment that is made and after all the stress and worry I still end up going for the cheapest available within reason that I can at least find one half decent review for. I am therefore going to give a very blunt and honest review to try and save you the same pressure i unnecessarily put myself through each time i plan a trip. - Its was rated as a 3 star hotel - i feel this is a correct rating in comparison to other places I have stayed. Ive given a pointer for each catagory and then written more details below - Location - Close enough to be convenient but far enough to be quiet!!!! Hotel Room - Small but clean and equipped. Food - Continental and as you would expect from this level of hotel - But no room service! Staff - Mostly friendly Noise - Quiet and no "Louts or Stag / Hen Parties" Location - It was in a quieter part of the City Centre - Approximately 5 minutes from nearest cafes and restaurants, Approx 15 minutes from Dam Square, Central Station and Red Light District. If like us you are into Strolling and taking in the surroundings it really does not feel a long walk as you are looking at canals and monuments along the way and stopping for the occasional drink. When booking tours they do a bus service from the hotel so there is no need to worry about getting to the tour near central station. In the opposite direction about 10 mins away you have the Artis Zoo (this was expensive at over 18 euros a ticket so we didn't bother) but another 10 mins further on is the Oosterpark which was peaceful and very pretty. Living in a town near London I like having everything on tap and can be a bit lazy with walking - I did not feel this hotel was too far out or a problem. Furthermore on the odd night where you are worn out from walking or had one too many holiday cocktails then the tram is cheap and very accessible. Oh and the Ice bar is only 5 mins away Hotel - From the outside was not the best (but then you are not there to stare at the outside) After reading reviews on here about the canabis smells and thugs I was nervous expecting the worst but must say extremely surprised it was clean, fresh and modern looking. The Reception staff were friendly. Our flight was early before the room was ready so they happily locked our bags away for us and explained where we could get food and drinks etc. Room - When entering the bedroom i was a little disappointed by the size (it is small) but again it was clean, modern, fresh and very well equipped. The TV was a large flat screen and had several English channels, the bed although a small double was comfortable with crisp sheets. Bathroom - This was probably the most disappointing as it was Tiny. Don't expect to pamper yourself in the bath as there is not one and the toliet is so close to the wall you have to sit sideways. However, again it was well equipped with a warm shower with good pressure. We didn't get any hot/cold situations and the hairdryer although not the best, did its job. Food - The breakfast was standard. It is continental and same each day Consisting of Croissants, Bread, Rolls, Tea Cakes, Boiled Eggs (although luke warm) Scrambled Egg, jams, cereal, yogurt and tinned fruit plus some pineapple. It is not the best by any means and don't expect a hearty fry up or hangover cure but it filled a gap and was included in our price. Normal Selection of Drinks. The only downside was that you cant get Room service so if you want a romantic breakfast in bed its not available. We did ask reception if we could take food back up to bedroom and they agreed but be careful as this is not correct information. Do not attempt to remove food from the restaurant as the two little chinese waitresses will pounce on you, waving their fingers, shouting no no no! and creating a scene in front of all the other diners so unless you have thick Skin like my other half who gave as good as he got I would recommend stick with not attempting breakfast in bed in this hotel :-) Staff - Polite, well spoken, friendly (apart from waitresses if you remove the food), Noise - I was from other reviews a little worried I would be kept up all night or in the morning but have to say our room was very quiet. The average guests we saw at breakfast were middle age couples and young couples. One group of 4 guys in their 20s but we experiences no noise trouble. Did not see one stag party or any "Louts" near the hotel area. Overall - We could not fault our trip but we expect to get what we pay for. If I want 5 star to enjoy a luxury hotel with huge baths, tip top Staff and incredible food then I spend Â£400 a night to go to the Dorchester London or George V in Paris. If I want a last minute good city break for a reasonable figure where I am more interested in the Sights and Experiences then this hotel did a good job and was clean quiet and friendly. I would recommend it :-)

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but........”
Reviews.Author: nbalwaystravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. If you are looking for space, don't stay here. Two people with any more than two small suitcases will not be happy!!! The beds were hard, the room was not soundproof and the hotel is generally just in need of a tidy up. However, the staff are very nice, the room was clean and if you like watching TV you will be pleasantly surprised at the size of the TV in such a small room. There is a safe in the room and also tea and coffee making facilities. Breakfast was OK, but not startling. Its OK , but overall I think the hotel is over priced for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: KrisKolumbus
Reviews.Content: With this hotel location is everything - a less than 10 minute comfortable stroll to Dam Square more then make up for the small rooms. Perfect for short break where your more interested in the city and sights then in the hotel any longer then 3 nights may be claustrophobic. Our room was clean and tidy and no issues with plumbing, staff or breakfast which comprised the usual croissants, rolls, bread, cheese, ham, yogurt and eggs. Only real downside of this hotel is no lounge where you can have quiet drink before retiring

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a night stay... not more, no thrills, but everything works!”
Reviews.Author: Stan040
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location in the central part of Amsterdam. It is very clean and everything works, good, big TVs in the tiny rooms, everything is new and clean. My firs impression - there is a big resemblance to a student's dormitory. The breakfast is good but without too much choice. No luxury, no pampering for the guest, but one should not expect it from this type of average-low rate Dutch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected at all !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tonie100
Reviews.Content: This has been one of the worst hotels that i have ever stayed in. Although the reception staff were very nice and helpful the rooms were very basic and the bathroom in need of major refurbishment.Breakfast was absolutely horrendous unless you like boiled eggs and ham. Hotel itself has no garden and is covered in nettles and weeds on arrival. Tea and coffee facilities are of a minimum and milk is very hard to come by. There is no double glazing so be prepared to hear noise. The location is not as close as appears to central station and is a good 20-30 min walk . Overall for the price that we paid we could have spent and extra Â£20 and stayed in luxury elsewhere. Good job i had a good friend to make it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “We WILL NOT be back”
Reviews.Author: shorty32
Reviews.Content: We were VERY disappointed with this hotel as the double room that we were given was absolutely tiny. It was very expensive for what we got, and there was people obvoiusly smoking pot throughout the hotel as it stank. Thre was no AC either. The chinese lady who served breakfast was very rude and not friendly. Would not recommend this hotel...should have booked Hotel Ibis next door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMYD2011
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for two nights and besides the odd smell which seemed to constantly occupy the reception and corridor area on the ground floor; it was a nice place to stay. Our room was pleasant and big enough for the two of us. I must say the beds are very comfortable and along with the large tv and tea/coffee facilities in the room we found it easy to wind down as if at home after the long days walking around Amsterdam. We were supplied with showergel and soap etc, as well as fresh towels daily, also a refil for the tea and coffee. We found the hotel was quite a walk from where we wanted to be and the quickest route was to walk through the unpleasant red light district although once we found our bearings and other routes we quite enjoyed the walk; apart from the syco cyclists. There is a convenient supermarket a short walk away and there are a few nice resturaunts and cafes close by. The hotel will lend you an umbrella if the weather is poor which we found very handy as we didnt come prepared for the rain. One warning: They have a book in each room stating extortionate charges for each item you take or break. When we initially arrived at the hotel we witnessed this being enforced as an angry customer seemed to be being charged a silly amount for something either damaged or broken in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Rush Back”
Reviews.Author: Louloub78
Reviews.Content: Very small room, although had been expecting this in Amsterdam. The whole hotel needs updating and our room didn't smell fresh. The mattress on the bed was awful, we felt every spring in it, hardly slept a wink! The room was generally clean enough but there was a vent on the ceiling in the shower and it was covered in mould. However, location was fairly good and the 2 members of staff on reception I encountered were friendly and helpful. It could of been worse but I certainly won't be booking here again!

Reviews.Title: “No need to risk...”
Reviews.Author: serdarali
Reviews.Content: The room was not clean, window was open when we visited, and freezing for the ifrst night. . The heater was not working. I warned the reception for the heater, he said it is summer, no need for heater. It works between 8-10 pm. at 8.30 pm, I asked why it is not working, and he told me, I dont know, nobody aksed for it, I didnt check!!! I wanted him to operate the heaters since it was 16 degrees, and he continuously told me it is summer (maybe 50 times). Than I had to threaten him to talk with his boss. 5 minutes later he brought me a small additional heater telling me that he found from the next hotel. When I was returning, the lady did not get surprised for it and put to the nezxt room, which was owned by Falcon. If you are ready to got frozen, and if you are ready to discuss with this kind of people in this hotel, just book it. Otherwise, I would never stay in this hotel, for my next 500 visits.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs.”
Reviews.Author: AusTraveller_11
Reviews.Content: For 173 Euros for one night, this is what I received: The tiniest room i've EVER stayed in. It was seriously like Harry Potter's room under the stairs. DO NOT ACCEPT ANY ROOM NUMBERED 300, 400 etc - these are tiny, overpriced shoeboxes. At night the room was so hot and there is no air conditioning or fans in the room. The pillows are extremely lumpy. The curtain doesn't cover the whole window - it only covers half the window, so people can see in and in the morning the sun wakes you up at 6am. When I asked for another pillow the guy at the reception said he couldn't help me as I was only staying for one night. The toilets on the ground floor are dirty and the door doesn't lock properley. THIS HOTEL IS A FILTHY HOLE, really. DO NOT STAY HERE. What's more, they charged me room 'taxes' and the internet is not free. All for 173 euros!! I hope the management are happy for ripping me off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice no frills hotel, good location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sheardypants
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location close to trams but nicely out of the way of everything. Good friendly staff. Rooms were ok, no aircon. Very good shower couldnt spend a week in it though. Breakfast self services and adequate. All in all it was ok didn't have a bad experience so would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a budget get away”
Reviews.Author: mcelhinneyrach
Reviews.Content: just got back from a 3 night stay at the Falcon Plaza Firstly i must say i wasnt hopeing for much after reading all the bad reviews but seriously i think those people r kidding themselves, there's little wrong with the place! Staff - very friendly and helpful. 24 hr reception Rooms - clean, tidy, massive TV with Sky channels, tea and coffee making facilities, comfy beds, looks newly refurbished location - quite, just outside the busy centre. supermarket and bar at end of street. also a market, 5-10 mins from rembrant square you'll do ALOT of walking so take good shoes! would totally stay here again, its a good base for a budget break, and above what you would expect. 1000 times better than any travel ldge thats for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Place”
Reviews.Author: Zenman1965
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the All Seasons with my 13 and 15 year old kids but when we arrived they had overbooked and put me here. In someways the location was much better, it is a short walk from a large supermarket and then probably another ten minutes to downtown and also the tram lines. So that worked well. The lady on reception was very helpful when we arrived. We stayed in room 106 on the ground floor, it has four beds and was a good size. he shower was fairly basic but OK. My only concern was security as it had two large glass doors out onto a yard at the back of the hotel. But we had no problems while we stayed there. However this room was right next to the Kitchen and a "fan", so at 6am we were typically woken up and i found it hard to get back to sleep. We didn't eat here so I cannot comment on that. There is parking next door that is 28 Euros a day, which i thought was a lot, but i guess London would have been more. All in all the location made this a very practical stay, but it was nothing grand.

Reviews.Title: “half star hotel. not recommended”
Reviews.Author: ValeDario
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not more than 1 star. I don't know how they wash the towels but there were always stains on them. the toilet wasn't very clean and the tiles on the wall smelled of pee. The beds were very uncomfortable and I had a sore back/neck every day but the worst think was that every time someone walked or opened a door on the other floors you could hear them as if they were in your room. For me it was impossible to sleep! so this is the hotel: noisy, stinky and dirty!

Reviews.Title: “nice big tv in the rooms and the windows opened nicely to allow plenty of air in”
Reviews.Author: Deniska77
Reviews.Content: Delighted to get a double room when booked for a single. Generous space for Amsterdam. Great rate though I guess it was mid-January. Good breakfast of the Dutch type. Vending machine sells Heineken. Shower was a little temperamental and periodically scolded me.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: LondonPaul
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price for a hotel just 10 minutes walk from Dam Sqaure, with several local supermarkets and cafes which is handy. My single room and bed were pretty small (more like a ships cabin really) but that is not unusual for Amsterdam. As a bonus, though, the hotel has a lift! The room was very clean and well decorated with plenty of storage space for a solo traveller, plus a kettle, powerful hot shower and a decent sized TV. The lack of air conditioning could be a problem for some in Summer, but I just left my window open and wasn't concerned. The breakfast was typical Amsterdam fare: cheese, hams, yoghurt, cereal, eggs etc served from 7-10 in a large dining area. Would certainly recommend it for a budget traveller taking ashort break, and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: traveller186504
Reviews.Content: I would never stay in this hotel again even if it was free. it was terrible. staff awful, rooms awful, noise awful but food ok. the bath shower screen. the bath screen was fitted of the bath. (what a joke) the toilet was fitted in the middle of the bathroom. the smell came back up the basin waste. IT WAS A DIVE.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptbale "tourist class" hotel”
Reviews.Author: trustme555
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Generally the rooms were quite small â€“ especially if you are in the rooms on the side of the building with room 109, 209, 309 etc. To be honest they were a bit too small for two people sharing. However, the rooms on the other side with room 104, 204, 304, etc werenâ€™t too bad. Cleanliness: Overall, the rooms and bathrooms were fine. Given that we new it was a 3 star hotel we had no complaints. To a minor extent the hotel could do with a bit of redecoration â€“ but nothing to get worked up about. Bathrooms: Compact but clean â€“ shower / bath gel and shampoo supplied. Towels clean and fresh. Showers were very powerful (excellent) Beds: Very comfortable with clean white sheets. Breakfast: Continental breakfast (normal) . No problems at all. Hotel Location: Tram 9 from Central Station to Waterlooplein or 15 minutes walk from Central Station and Dam Square. Supermarket 2 mins walk (very handy). CafÃ©/Restaurant 2 mins walk (again very handy)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luvtravel022
Reviews.Content: Good location within 15min walk from central station. Reception staff very helpful. Room was clean and modern. I had a single room which was on the small side with a compact en-suite, but as it was only base to sleep, it didn't matter. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Furry Mould on the Bathroom Walls and Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Shelbs44
Reviews.Content: We checked-in to this hotel thinking that we had gotten a great deal for a location that was only a 10 minute walk from the central train station. When we got to our room, we un-packed and then checked out the washroom. BIG MISTAKE! We should have looked in the washroom before even setting our bags down. There was black and grey fury mould growing across all of the walls into the edges of the shower. We then checked under the mattress to see if the bed was actually clean and there were not one - but two urine stains on the mattress and piles of dust and dirt. We went downstairs to speak with the manager and ask him to look at the room. He flicked some chunks of mould off the bathroom wall and told me that it wasn't his problem. When I told him that we wanted to check out or speak to a manager he started yelling at me in the middle of the lobby in front of other guests and said that I was not aloud to speak and that there was no manager. Finally my boyfriend had to speak with him and managed to get the hotel manager on the phone. After an hour, he agreed to let us check out immediately. This was my worst hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Young_couple28
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on Last Minute.com on which the rating was 3 star, however on our two-day stay in Amsterdam we found the hotel exceeded our expectations going by other reviews. It is in an excellent location, we rarely needed to use public transport and the reception staff were very friendly helpful with directions. The room was a good size and cosy with storage for both of us and a huge TV! The bathroom was very clean. We were provided fresh towels every day, and the hotel is on a quiet street despite being close to the centre so we had no disturbances. There is also a large convenience store 2 minutes walk away. Everything you need is nearby, with trams and a subway down the street. We think previous reviews are not accurate and possibly written by picky people! We would happily stay here again and I have recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pretty good location for price”
Reviews.Author: bethpo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is probably a 20 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal or about a 5 minute walk from the nearest metro (just 2 or 3 stops from the station), so it's pretty close to everything. There aren't a lot of restaurants or cafes right by it, but if you go to the right when you leave the hotel, you can find some streets with quite a few and an Albert Heijn supermarket just a few blocks away. The room itself was nice, clean and had a very large flat-screen TV. We would've preferred a double bed rather than the two twins pushed together, because the crack between the two would sometimes grow during the night. You have to pay for the Internet, but you can buy it for a whole day or two at a decent rate and a good connection.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: cfd9999999
Reviews.Content: I spent one awful night in this hotel last week. The single bed more than half-filled the tiny room, the washroom was tiny and there was a terrible smell from the drain, the room (number 200) was right at the bottom of the stairs and I was kept awake all night by people coming and going, the room was far too hot and the window couldn't be safely held open a little (i.e. I couldn't stop it from swinging 100% open). Finally, after about 2 hours of sleep I was awakened at 6am and kept awake by a huge ventilation fan positioned right outside my window. I've never had a poorer nights sleep in any hotel. There are plenty of hotels in Amsterdam to choose from, so next time I'll try another one.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: bobimara
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 nights stay in Amsterdam at the Falcon Plaza. We've arrived one hour before check-in time and only waited for 5 minutes to get to our room. It was on the 4th floor, but there was a working lift. The room was very small, bathroom even smaller. It was generally clean, apart from the net curtains and curtains which were crying out loud to be washed! Oh, and the windows needed a clean! The walls were very thin, you could hear everything happening on that floor, there was no double glazing so you could hear all the traffic from the outside, which was dying out in the evening. Shower was a bit temperamental, sometimes the water temperature was getting colder, sometimes really hot. The bed was very soft and we had a backache for the first 2 days, got used to it afterwards, but looking forward to our nice bed at home! The room was serviced every day, the only thing it was that the housekeeper was forgetting to give us a bath mat, so we had to use a hand towel for 2 days. Breakfast was buffet, continental style- nice coffee, plenty of orange and apple juice, rolls, croissants(dry),bread, cheese and ham and salami, jams and butter, chocolate spread, peanut butter, cheese spread, omlette and boiled eggs, tomatoes and cucumber. All of these you could just help yourself anytime, we have found it very good.The 2 asian ladies at breakfast were always efficient and polite. The hotel staff were helpfull as well-to note the Israeli woman and the Asian guy in reception,they've helped us with train times, travel directions and attractions to visit. To cut it short, good value for money, we've only paid 51 euros per night for bed and breakfast for the 2 of us, booked straight on the hotel's website though.

Reviews.Title: “rip off”
Reviews.Author: ianPenzanceEngland
Reviews.Content: myself and a friend stayed there on the 24th jan for two nights.the morning we left we were ripped off again for a so called service charge they called it to put an extra towel in our room,were there was only 1 on arrival for a twin room.we were charged 30 euros,would never go back again even if it was for free

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: bean_ari
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel stay ever. My room was not even numbered so I could not find it and had to return to the reception to ask where it was. It was FAR TOO EXPENSIVE. My room was tiny, the bed was broken underneath, the bedsheets were torn, there was an old used tea bag inside the kettle, the cup and saucer were chipped. I had a 30 second shower and then heard a man tapping on my door to get out of my room, so I whipped on a towel, only to be told that in order to shower I had to open the window to avoid the steam setting off the fire alarm- as it had apparently done (not that I heard any siren...) then for breakfast, which I had not been told was extra fee, I was charged 12euros for the worst breakfast spread a hotel has ever provided. I read on the internet that the hotel has a fitness centre, it does not. I could hear loudly everything going on in the hallways. Wifi also costs extra. The receptionist even refused to print out my boarding pass after I did an online check in for my flight the next day. The service was rude and I was overall EXTREMELY disappointed in the stay I had.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: dougie1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for new years weekend, the room was small and basic but had a huge tv on the wall,good safe where you enter your own locking/unlocking code.There was mildew mould on the windows and you couldnt help thinking that with a little investment it would be a great hotel. the bathroom was small with a great shower but the toilet was placed in a corner against the wall so you had to sit on it sideways!!!.Breakfast was continental which was basic fare, croissants, bread for toast, hams,cheese, boiled eggs and scrambled eggs, fruit juices and machine coffee, the breakfast room seems like it was once a chinese restaurant judging by the decor and furniture.Reception staff were friendly and check in was smooth, the room was serviced each day by housekeeping.There was a computer available at 2 euros for 30 minutes but didnt have a printer which would have been handy for printing tickets after checking in online for the flight home, we did this at the Ibis next door which costs 5 euros per session.The hotel is easily accesible by trams 9 and 14 from dam square, get off at Mr Visserplein around the corner or at Waterlooplein which is a 2 minute walk, Rembrandt plein is approx 5 minutes walk away and dam square around 20 minute walk or 10 minutes on the tram. The flower market is nearby and the flea market is just before Waterlooplein. A tidy hotel within good distance to all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for any more”
Reviews.Author: Judith082
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, good sized rooms, breakfast lovely, could have a joke with reception staff, we were looked after brilliantly. Could not complain about anything, will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your expectations realistic - getting what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: msru
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest hotel stay in the world, but it's close to city center - 10 minute walk to the red light district, and about 15-20 minute walk to Central Station. It's not expensive but not cheap either, but keep in mind what you're paying for - a 3-star hotel in the center of Amsterdam. What do you expect?

Reviews.Title: “Close to central Amsterdam, reasonable quality for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: i_lovez_2_travel
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, bedding clean, curtains clean. Bathroom a little dated, probably needs an upgrade, but was clean, which is acceptable. Wooden floor in our room a little squeaky, annoying rather than a major issue. Comfortable bed. Room facilities: double/twin bed, sidetables with lamps for each, large flat-screen TV, desk with chair, kettle and tea-making facilities, extra chair, cupboard with safe, 'shelf' for bag storage. Bathroom - Shower over bath, the best shower we've ever had, excellent pressure and heat control, large mirror over sink, hairdryer. The only negative, the toilet roll-holder across the room so you have to lean quite far. Location - close to central Amsterdam, about 5-10minutes walk. Was a bit far from the train station, about 25mins walk with a large pull-along bag. Internet about 5.00 Euro per day, but quite fast. Staff will provide limited printing if required, just ask at front desk. Breakfast the same every day, but good. Juices, water, milk, coffee machine, croissants and various buns, toast, various spreads available, cold meats, cheese, fruit, yoghurt, cereals, scrambled eggs and sausages. No bacon though :-( Staff were quite friendly and helpful. Good reasonable quality hotel, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not to go -a mafiahotel”
Reviews.Author: AnonimusBucharest
Reviews.Content: We were in august 2010! Located in center! But: Rooms very small and dirty; beds very uncomfortable In addition we were stolen (my bag) at the breakfast in the restaurant with the accept of the stuff,they saw the 2 arabian man who took the bag and the receptionist(an asian man) delayd to call the police The general oppinion (the other guests in restaur) was they were in combination!!1 It was a nightmare,don"t go there!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Wouldn't repeat”
Reviews.Author: Dani_Barcelona34
Reviews.Content: Let's start by saying that we booked only one day in advance, so there were not many hotels at a reasonable price to choose ... after searching for a while we booked a room in Falcon Plaza Hotel at 90 euros per night. The room was very small, and the bathroom was even worse (only one person could get in it at the same time). Moreover, it was not very clean (in fact, some days they didn't clean our room at all), and they didn't change bed clothes in the 7 nights we spent there. All in all, quite a disappointing hotel, although I must say that it is quite well located, near city center.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel walking distance from central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: jgrob1
Reviews.Content: This budget hotel, walking distance to the central districts of Amsterdam was a great find. The room was clean and reasonably well appointed with a huge flatsceen and a clean, decent sized bath/showeroom. The staff were friendly and helpful. Parking was attached to the hotel and charged at a reduced rate of 28 Euros/24 hours for hotel guests (as opposed to 35 Euros/24 hours) - this is pretty cheap for central Amsterdam, the parking lot opposite was 48 Euros for 24 hours! A great stay, recommended and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel for leisure guests”
Reviews.Author: Axe10
Reviews.Content: My family traveled to Amsterdam in Easter and we stayed at Hotel Falcon Plaze for three nice nights. The reception staff is very friendly and help me to park my auto in the garage of the hotel. I am very satisfied with this facility because I do not need to worry about my auto at all. The hotel offers very good breakfast, my wife and my son are very happy. It is close to the city center and the surrounding of the hotel is very beautiful and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely decent hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BrotherTuck
Reviews.Content: We were a bit scared from earlier reviews but realized quickly that we had no reason to. Enjoy a stay here, friendly staff, clean room with large tv-screen, boiler and so on. And the breakfast with ordinary and scrambled eggs different kinds of marmelades, several types of bread, cereals and croissants. Coffee machine makes the coffee directly from the beans.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: saasCork
Reviews.Content: it was a nice hotel, really clean. we had a double room and altough we got a shock when we first saw our room and how small it was it turned out to be really comfortable and cosy. the hotel staff could'nt have been more helpful. it was about a 10-15 minute walk to the city centre but enjoyable . we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great beds, good view, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: noregretgirl
Reviews.Content: the hotel is close to the train station, at least a 15 minute walk to anything else, which wasnt a problem. Got a quad room, great size, overlooked the canal, so pretty! Great room size, SOFTEST BEDS OF MY WHOLE TRIP! staff was friendly and the room was quiet. no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Possibly The Worst Hotel I Have Ever Stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: qwerty1234qwerty
Reviews.Content: after a late flight, the first thing you want is to sleep. as soon as i got there my room was not ready, and when it was the bathroom was filthy. the bed's were not made correctly and the power sockets were not working as was the TV. When i asked to be moved the rude staff said that all the other rooms were booked. funny as in the 4 days i was there, i did not a see a single visitor. the night shift receptionist was much worse than the one in the day. i asked him to book me a taxi, he said he had and it would be 15 min's. 45 mins later i came down to reception and when i asked he said he did not order it, and that i could order it from the phone in my room, he seemed to be too busy watching movies on his computer. the location is not too bad. it is not far from dam square, and is close to a grocery store. I would strongly recommend not staying here, there is a much better hotel just next door called the ibis.

Reviews.Title: “Warning----Do not stay here, its hell”
Reviews.Author: LEGGYHARRY
Reviews.Content: THE RECEPTION STAFF HAVE NO MANNERS. We have just come back from a short weeknd break and stayed at the Falcon Plaza, IT WAS A NIGHTMARE from start to finish. We booked via the inernet for 3 people in a triple room, and ended up with a double room that had only 2 single beds......................! The reception stafff called us liars and that we had booked it incorrectly, and basically said if we are not happy, then feel free to leave as it was non-refundable, even though it was not our error. The rooms are dirty and smell of stale urine and smoke, and the view out of the window was disgusting. The reception staff were'nt even prepared to offer us another room unless we payed more, and barely gave us a spare towel, pillow, or even a bedcover. When leaving the hotel were we charged an extra 30euros per night for staying in a double room, and stood shouting at us till we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: bozze
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel located just outside the city centre (walking distance). I went there with car and parked it in their garage just next door, I got the tiniest spot I've ever seen and were barely able to get outside of the car... The man working there was also a bit rude and not very service-minded... All aspects of the hotel itself is average, except the size of the (single) room I had, it was extremely small and rather noisy (located just beside the stairs). The breakfast was decent, nothing special but it was enough to satisfy me. If your looking for a rather cheap hotel located just outside of the city centre in a quiet area then this could be it, but don't except too much...

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: Liliute
Reviews.Content: we spent a weekend there. the bathroom was smelling really bad. there was a ventillation noise all night. breakfast was ok. but not really a hotel to spent a romantic weekend...

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneMrEd
Reviews.Content: After a couple of very dissapinting experiences it was an absolute delight to arrive and discover that this hotel met with all our expectations. it is well located in a relatively quiet street. We had a back room that ovelooked the canal. Room was very spacious, spotless and well appointed. Staff were friendly and helpful. my only minor criticism is that breakfast option is limited and priced only around a full cooked breakfast When you only require a bowl of cereal, glass of fruit juice and a cup of tea a price of around 15 Euro per head is a bit over the top! Otherwise a hotel to be highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: SCSY
Reviews.Content: If there's only one thing that I can say to put you off, then it must be that only 2/3of my bed was covered by a bedsheet. I regret not having taken a photo. As I had only tucked myself under the blanket on the first night, I didn't notice that the lower third of my single bed wasn't covered. For God knows what reason, the bedsheet was too small. I'd only noticed it in the middle of the night when my PJ rolled up and my legs felt the rough texture of the mattress underneath. Of course I pointed it out to the receptionist the next morning. He appeared appalled, saying that is unacceptable, and will have it changed immediately. What a liar! When I came back to the room at night, it was status quo. As I had only one more night left, I left it as it is. This is in addition to another complaint that I had lodged in the first evening to another receptionist. Our room's main light wasn't working. He came up to check, after which he suggested us bearing with it and relying on the bedside lamps first, and he'll have it rectified the following morning. Another liar! So together with the bedsheet, I complained again about the lights to the second receptionist. Not surprisingly, nothing was changed at all. Location's not as good as described. Unless you're fit enough to walk, don't opt for this hotel. I'd gone with my in-laws, who can't walk as much, and ended up having to take the tram everywhere. After a walk around the city, you'll realize that there're actually many more better located hotels, for similar, if not cheaper price. All in all, it was bad experience. And I'd consider it a rip-off, especially after looking at the cheaper and yet more pleasant Ibis Stopera next door. Another tip, read more about the same hotel from different review websites. During my research process, I'd only relied on one or two websites for comparison. Although this hotel rated on par with some of those that I'd shortlisted, they were very differently rated on others, as I'd found out too late.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: rachandsteve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Falcon Plaza for a short break last month having got a good deal for a late package booking. Having seen a number of negative reviews and the hotelâ€™s low ranking on this website, we were a little concerned before we went. However, we neednâ€™t have worried and our experience of the hotel was very positive. It was a comfortable, friendly and extremely good value-for-money base for our stay in Amsterdam. The hotelâ€™s location might not be ideal for anyone wanting to be right in the very heart of the Cityâ€™s nightlife. However, it is only a 5 minute walk from the transport hub of Waterlooplein, and, for people like us who are happy to walk around the city, it was a comfortable walking distance to most of Amsterdamâ€™s attractions. Approximate walking distances from the hotel to various places are:- nearby restaurants (5 minutes), Rembrandtsplein (10 mins), Red Light District (10 mins), Dam Square (15 mins), Central Station (15 mins), Anne Frank House (20 mins) Leidesplein (20-25 mins). The hotel doesnâ€™t look anything special from the outside (and not as nice as the Ibis next door) but it is fine inside. It is situated on a non-touristy street which seems to have a lot of furniture/interior design showrooms. One apartment a couple of doors along from the hotel does look shabby but the rest of the street is fine and we felt safe walking at all times. We stayed in room 310 which was clean, spacious and nicely-decorated, with side views of a canal. It also had a Plasma TV, free room safe and a good-sized bathroom with bath/shower. It was much better than we were expecting to be honest. The breakfasts were also good:- fairly standard continental fayre but with hot scrambled eggs and particularly nice fresh bread, and much better than my previous two Amsterdam experiences at other tourist class hotels. The decoration in some of the hotelâ€™s corridors looks a little tired in places, but nothing too off-putting. The staff on the reception and in the breakfast room were friendly and efficient, so, overall, we had a very good stay at the Falcon Plaza and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, good breakfast, good TV, small room”
Reviews.Author: BalancedJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a room fro 3. Good and clean room but small. Shower was excellent and powerful. Breakfast good. Cheap for us during the week, great value compared with other hotels nearby. BIG tv on the wall. 15 min walk to the centre. Not close to any coffee shops ( 10 mins away - too far when your mangled). All in all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Falcon Plaza Hovel”
Reviews.Author: vinnybrooks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Falcon over the Valentines weekend. Arriving @ 23.00h, we were presently surprised to see that a room was still available. Unfortunately this was on the 4th floor, that was ok, or so we thought until we were informed the lift wasn't working. After climbing 4 flights of stairs. We breathlessly entered the very small room our immediate thoughts were we are not staying here, however after a quick evaluation of the situation. We decided that we'd be better staying there that night, then find somewhere else the next day. In reality we stayed the 2 nights, but spent very little time at hotel. We went for Breakfast which was of a continental style and very minimalist. The waitress removed a bowl of fruit salad as it needed to be replenished but then brought it back in the same state there was some scrambled egg which she moved about a bit to make it more appealing. We didnâ€™t bother again with breakfast as we would have used up more calories climbing up and down the stairs the breakfast offered. The Hotel is situated on a main road about 15 walk from where you would prefer to be I would therefore suggest you find somewhere closer to the attractions or stay at the Ibis next door. The Hotel is of an acceptable state of cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “great value and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: f2point8
Reviews.Content: we needed a place to stay after a rough night in a hostel, and this little hotel was a lifesaver! didn't look like much from the sidewalk, but the room was spotless, as was the bathroom. the bed was clean, comfortable, and we slept soundly even though there was some noise from the hallway. this hotel appeared to have been renovated recently, and we liked having a flat screen tv, as well as a coffee maker. the staff was friendly and the included breakfast was fine. the only negative was there was absolutely no parking for our rental car, but in general i'd totally recommend this place for a single or couple looking to crash someplace relatively nice but inexpensive in amsterdam central.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craigeh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 210, overlooking a canal and brick wall. Room was clean, staff very friendly and courtious, have no complaints about the room, location or hotel. Highly recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Run the opposite direction!”
Reviews.Author: toufLondon
Reviews.Content: My god! what a [--}! The smell in the reception as we arrived , the area , next door looked looked like a crack den, sleazy men hanging around. We left after 15 minutes of arriving and cancelled the two rooms booked yet we still got charged, But rather-that then stay at this [--]. There are other nice hotels that are clean for the same price, with a canal view, why do it??

Reviews.Title: “what a bargain”
Reviews.Author: roxy2508
Reviews.Content: Group of 5 for birthday bash from aylesbury and london.. Uopn arrival staff were friendly and helpfull hotel looks good.. Rooms are well equipped and clean nd tidy,decorated to a high standard. .Beds are comfortable and clean,bedding changed daily and rooms cleaned daily.. Fresh towels every day and more than we needed.. Overall rooms were excellent and the luxury of a plasma tv with sky tv was an extra added bonus. Breakfast was continental and the choice of boiled and scrambled eggs good food and staff freindly and helpfull.. Not far from the center and trams and buses are frequent. The hotel and staff are one of the best i have stayed in and will certainly reccomend it to family and frends.. In our opinion its at least a 3+ star rating by comparing some of the other hotels we have stayed in in amsterdam. If you are looking for a nice clean good standard hotel in a prime area and for a good price then look up this hotel..you will be suprised................................ Hills,vikki,forrest,fatboy and amy

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: MaitetxuEuskalHerria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 07. Our room was a quad room and we were very satisfied with it because it was big enough for all of us. The bathboom with a small window was a good size and it had a big bath. It was spotlessly clean and it was very light. There was a big window and we had a wonderful canal view from it. Beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Bill-in-UK
Reviews.Content: Having had to go to Amsterdam for a few days on business I booked the hotel as part of a package. Once booked I looked further into other reviews of the Hotel and read a few that raised my concerns on the quality of the Hotel. However when I arrived at the Hotel I can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised. As with most places your first impression is that given to you by the peolpe on reception. In this instance I found the receptionists to be very polite and helpful and this boded well for my stay. My room was very clean and comfortable ( I was on the ground floor) and the bathroom had adequate towels and soap. The plasma tv in the room is not something you would normally expect to see and the room had tea and coffee making facilities as well as a little fridge. It was also nice to open the wardrobe and find a decent quantity of clothes hangers!!. Even though the Hotel was fully booked the only time I heard other guests was in the morning when they were leaving. The buffet breakfast was, as most people have previously reported, above that which you would normally expect and the staff were very courteous and polite. The Hotel does not have a bar but as there was one at the hotel next door this was not a major concern. It does however have a drinks machine and a small snack machine should you get thirsty or peckish during the day or night. As I was not driving I did not need to avail myself of the car parking facilities but the receptionists were very happy to order taxi's for me when needed and they usually arrived within 10 minutes of being ordered. All in all I enjoyed staying at this hotel and would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice, never agian”
Reviews.Author: DonegalLady28
Reviews.Content: booked through hotels1800 website, therefore trusted it was good hotel. arrived and for starters the lights of the falcon plaza sign were only half working.. i thought oh no.. thats a bad sign.. arrived to room, extremely small and pokey and dingy,, bathroom was extremely tiny.. carpets throughtout were old and shabby, place stank, the lift was years old. also was very far away from the main areas..

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireEvil_Homer
Reviews.Content: When we booked the break through a holiday travel firm, we were told this was the only hotel which had vacancies. When we arrived, I could see why!! Check in was fine, but when we got to the second floor, there were a couple of builders working around the lift. They had laid planks of wood, cabling and plastic pipes right across where we had to go, and didn't offer to move them as we struggled past with suitcases. Not a good start! When we reached the room, it looked ok (at first glance) but on entering the bathroom, it was disgusting. There was dried blood on the wall and the bath was filthy. We cleaned this ourselves, but there is only so much you can do. Breakfast next morning was nothing to write home about either with a very limited choice. We had a great time in the city, but only returned to the hotel when we had to! When we arrived home, I wrote to the travel company to let them know what we had found. This was the first in my life that I have ever complained about a holiday! This is also my only negative view on trip advisor - yes, the hotel really is that bad!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: kittymarion
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Falcon Plaza Hotel last weekend and we've really enjoyed our stay. Although we had been hesitating to book this hotel at the beginning because of the negative reviews, we decided to book it after all, as we liked the location, being in the city-centre, but without the tumult. So, we went ahead and booked it and we are not regretting it at all. We had a wonderful stay in a beatiful room. All rooms had just been refurnished and the whole hotel been renovated. It smelt new and clean and we had a huge flatscreen, so we could watch our favourite program comfortably. We really liked the styling as well as the comfort. We are glad we didn't let us mislead by the old negative reviews, cause this hotel is brand new now and we would definately go back next time to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam has alot more to offer”
Reviews.Author: irisheyes11
Reviews.Content: the breakfast in the morning was fantastic but the rooms were terrible. The first room we had was very dusty and there where condoms outside the window. We moved to another room which I cleaned myself. this room was cramped, the door of the bathroom hit the bed as you opened it. I thought the pictures on the site were misleading. Overall you can get alot better in Amsterdam for alot less, I will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but below average”
Reviews.Author: Onvasurlemonde
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Falcon in December 2007. My four criteria for any hotel are price, location, safety and cleanliness. I'm sometimes forgiving when it comes to price and location is what it is. Safety and cleanliness are non-negotiables. That having been said, here is the breakdown for the Falcon: 1. Price: Amsterdam is an expensive city and this hotel has priced itself in the slightly above average zone. 2. Location: It's a short walk (8-15 mins, depending on your pace) to the city centre ie: it's not on your doorstep. There are no shops, cafes etc really near the hotel so if you are not keen on walking, this hotel is not for you. 3. Safety: I felt safe during my time at the hotel although there are some side streets nearby that I wasn't crazy about. 4. Cleanliness: Room were cleaned out everyday. I'm rating the hotel as below average because as well as all the items listed above, the beds were really, really lousy and some of the service at the front desk was a little brisk (not rude, just not that engaged either)

Reviews.Title: “Ok, good location ok accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: Dewz_Owen
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant, half way between rembrandt and the central station, where the canal hoppers start. very quiet hotel, not too many people stay there i dont think, think the scene is a bit strange, i thought the place was closed when we first got there its just the theme of the place is very dark. very nice inside, decent breakfast in the morning. Rooms are very nice looking with very comfo beds, only thing is it smells like the toilet is blocked and the windows do not open. not sure whether this is for every room or not. staff are very helpful but not very chatty. will help you if you need advice. overall an OK accomodation, ideal for stag do`s etc... as its close to most things. red light district is a 5/10 minute walk from the falcon plaza. Overall OK.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: NalaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and l stayed at The Falcon Plaza for three nights. In comparison to the many other hotels we stayed in for our 6 week holiday in the UK & Europe (cost & comfort) this hotel would be one of the worst, especially for the price we paid (not a lot, but certainly not the cheapest place we stayed), it was not good value for money at all, we paid much less for similar hotels in other cities and we paid the same rate for beautiful hotels in some cities. We paid a similar amount for our hotel in Sorrento Italy which had a view of the Bay of Naples, the town of Sorrento and a clifftop pool with view, doesn't seem right. Surely there is something better available in Amsterdam for a bit cheaper or somewhere nicer for the amount we paid. It was in an average location, on a main road with some seedy buildings around it. It is about a 10 minute walk into the heart of the town, which is quite a nice walk. We could hear the toilets flushing in the rooms above and next to ours and the showers. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom we experienced on our travels and the hot water was not regular at all, we had one hot hot shower in three nights. The bed was also very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare of a Hotel - A long overdue review”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTurk
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute reservation as we came back to Amsterdam from a trip to Turkey. We couldn't find any other hotels and ended up having to stay here for one of the worst nights ever!! Being on the plane for hours was better than this fetid place. Upon entry, the reception did not give away much and we thought, we can tolerate a hotel we haven't yet scoped out for just one night. As soon as we entered the hallway with rooms however, the scenery changed. A chamber maid was cleaning a room right next door and had casually taken the sheets, towels, you name it and plopped them onto the floor in the middle of the hallway. Yuck! Then we opened the door to our own personal hell. Our hotel room immediately stank of cigarettes and some other odors I don't care to identify. We noticed the carpet was littered with many mystery stains of impressive size. In addition, the window sill was full of cigarette butts, empty wine bottles and odd objects like a hair brush. The bathroom appeared to be clean but at this point we were so disgusted that we decided to shower in our slippers and not take them off unless they were to be replaced with shoes. We're not neat freaks mind you - just normal people that enjoy a healthy dose of hygiene. That night I dared to look at the mattress. What a mistake!! i won't go into the details here but I refrained from telling my husband what I saw lest he sleep standing up, propped against the wall or something. We did however, sleep in our clothes, vampire style with our hands crossed across our chest. Needless to say we were more than eager to get the hell out of this garbage place and get on our flight. I can safely tell you that our economy class seats were more comfortable and clean than that pig sty. We thought of taking pictures but decided against such a reminder of a horrible night on a trip that had been so pleasant. I did want to make sure to warn those who may be going to Amsterdam against this hotel though. Should you go, I highly recommend the hotel right next door or the Amsterdam American hotel. Have fun and stay clear of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. central location.”
Reviews.Author: hwkmichel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the falcon plaza hotel. Ideal base, within walking distance to the bars, shops and attractions. friendly staff. good value for money. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for a night...”
Reviews.Author: VTRDave
Reviews.Content: Only stayed the one night, as part of the extension to our Minicruise, and thought it was quite an alright hotel, considering it wasn't too expensive. Location was good, but a little hard to find! Breakfast was continental style, was quite average. Would return to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: danielic24
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Falcon plaza is a great ideal hotel to spend a few nights in when visiting Amsterdam. The staff were extremely friendly and polite. The room was clean and warm and had everything we needed for the weekend. Breakfast was simple but filling and the tables were cleared as soon as your bum came off the seat. Id stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room needed a thorough cleaning”
Reviews.Author: jsbmoky
Reviews.Content: Although the location is good, I would not stay here again because the room was dirty, fully of mosquitos (I'm still itching) and there was a lack of security (back door to an unattended garage did not lock, Front desk person gave us the room key without asking for ID). It seems that the property is just poorly managed and maintained. The front desk staff was friendly . One of them sent us to a nearby restaurant , Restaurant Greetje ( Pepperstraat 23) which was excellent - make reservations (tel. --). Cash only - not unusual in Amsterdam The Ibis Hotel is next door to the Falcon Plaza. It seems to be much cleaner and may be worth investigating.

Reviews.Title: “it's what you want to make of it!!!”
Reviews.Author: wolfe/jones
Reviews.Content: Yes other reviews are true, Felt that we paid a premium price to stay here for the type of accomodation that was on offer but we had come to see amsterdam not spend all day in the hotel room although having said that a major hang over on the first night meant that we did not surface till 3pm the next day but we were not disturbed by any maids hoovering or the previously mentioned noisey neighbours in fact the whole stay was rather quite even though the hotel was full over the weekend... the actual room was rather on the small side with the previously mentioned shower room door opening onto the bed but it was clean comfortable and warm and we had fresh towels every day..i,m afraid we can't comment on the breakfast as we never made it once!! the location wasn't as central as we were lead to believe but this was easily overcome by catching the metro approx 5 min walk and getting off at central station and exploring from there onwards.. do have to say though we did feel the location of the falcon plaza was a safe one and we both agreed that we would rather be where we were then right on top of all the action as the location of some of those hotels in the most central parts felt very dodgy!! To sum this experience up i would say this hotel was nothing special and some form of modernization wouldn't go a miss but if it's just a place to put your head down in a clean,comfortable and friendly enviroment then this hotel is fine..

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you expect!”
Reviews.Author: Geordie18
Reviews.Content: Me and a group of friends stayed here for a 21st birthday trip to Amsterdam and were happy with what we recieved. Yes the breakfast is VERY limited but they serve the most fabolous chocolate milk. The staff are divided in half, one half are great and you can spend hours talking to, the other half are the total opposite. The location is a slight walk but in a quiet and decent area. There are no "crack-heads" bothering you for money around here. Wether or not you enjoy your experience here will totally depend on what you want from a hotel. most of the good hotels are based on the outskirts of the city anyway, its mainly only the hostels that are right in the centre, It isnt the best hotel by far but its certainly not the worst either. our friend were scattered around the city as there were limited places available and we payed the least and had the best hotel. Try the Eden or the Atlanta. Not stayed in these but look good for similar price range. The rooms arent very big but are warm. The shower was a death trap, changing from nice warm water to scalding within lighting speed. bath works no problem. Has a good lift, has a safe in the room.....Use it. We didnt mind the walk to places, it doesnt take long, plus lets you see a bit more of the city. i personally thought it was in a good position, it was a five minute walk to everywere, some have attractions near but others miles away. Has a t.v. that doesnt really work. But at the end of the day, it provided a "safe" environment to lay your head at the end of a night. if youre expecting the ritz then dont stay here, you get what you pay for... It may cost more but its the difference between a good and bad trip,

Reviews.Title: “an overpriced and certainly over rated rat hole”
Reviews.Author: dolly2002
Reviews.Content: We saved for this trip for months and paid Â£180+ for what was described as a three star hotel - what a joke. The rooms were that small you could not even fully open the bathroom door as it banged of the bed. The walls i think are made of the notes they are ripping people off with! - you could hear everything from the room next door. The maids started hoovering at about 7am so hardly a relaxing stay. Miles from the centre not central as advertised and certainly not worthy of three stars. A complete rip off! don't bother stay at home!

Reviews.Title: “average rating seems fair.”
Reviews.Author: gavinkatie
Reviews.Content: not a bad hotel at all, rooms were clean and tidy, breakfast was enjoyable, the hotel is about a 5 min walk from the bizarre red light district. i would probabally look to book somewhere else if a went again, but if you have already booked this hotel, you will not be too disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Thepopples
Reviews.Content: Area: Not great, quite a walk to Dam Square and Central Station (I wouldn't want to do it with cases). This hotel is situated on a major (and noisy) road Parking: I was lead to believe it would be free...not so...you'll pay E25 per day...and I wasn't convinced about the security of my car at all. Customer Service: Friendly but not particularly helpful, equal to that of a (above average)hostel. Breakfast: Actually, not bad at all, I enjoyed it (even though I did feel as though I waas sitting in a chinese resturant, very odd. Rooms: It seemed that they had crammed as many beds in each room as possible, I had 4 single beds in my room, I have no idea why, I was taveling alone. I do have to comment on the sheets though, very comfortable...felt as soft as a baby's arse. I slept very well. Decor: Left a LOT to be desired, painting and carpeting was very shoddy and heavily used, it looked like the owner had got a couple of his mates to do the maintenance and they had taken him for a ride, this place seriously feels like a low budget motel, for a high star rated price. I didn't dare us ethe shower for fear of contracting some nasty fungal growth, bathroom was unacceptably dirty (and the light didn't work) I wouldn't stay here again, there are much better and more professional places for the same price

Reviews.Title: “great location, room very clean would recommend to all,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back after I organized a trip for 8 people, Rooms nice and clean, cleaned daily, breakfast good and fantastic location walking distance to all the main centre or a cheap taxi home if you don't want to walk. Staff very nice and cared about guest would have no hesitation in staying there again, only one negative points twin beds very close together,

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as all that - V.Good value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay - Feb 02 to 05. We had 3 twin rooms on the 1st floor paying 55 â‚¬uros for Thurs, and 80 â‚¬uros each for Fri & Sat night (210 â‚¬uros in total per room / Â£75each for 3 nights - which we all thought was good value). Included was a fairly basic buffet style breakfast, (same as mentioned in other reviews). Rooms were fairly small but most are in 'Dam. No views and in a fairly un-picturesque part of the city. However rooms were clean, linen fine, rooms serviced well and fresh towels every day. There was a TV, a wardrobe (with safe), a dressing table but the best feature was the hot power shower - just what you need after a day in the red light district... Toilet was too close to wall/radiator, so you had to ride sidesaddle or risk burning your leg/bum. Staff were mostly Chinese, all spoke English and seemed quite happy to help, (not that we needed to bother them). Reception was open 24hrs and although no bar, the IBIS has one & it's right next-door or there's a Sushi bar 200yrds away. I wouldn't recommend this for a family or a romantic weekend away but if you just need a cheap standard room with good shower located within 10mins walk of the centre then for the price, the place is absolutely fine!

Reviews.Title: “NO STARS JUST ONE BIG BLACK HOLE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wouldnt even rate this hotel as a 1* let alone the 3* it is supposed to be, it is just a big black hole and shouldnt be allowed to trade. Don't be deceived by the appearance of a smart enterance/reception area as past this the rooms are not even fit for a dog to sleep in. The rooms are dirty and the curtains and bedding were stained and ripped. The shower area was dirty and complete with mould and previous residents belongings. I think this says it all. The location wasnt great but OK so I would suggest you try booking into the IBIS which is next door.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel clean, breakfast plenty, night staff really friendly, bathroom deasent size, spar shop 2 mins away. The only prob we (4 lads) wanted a hotel in the center there is a 8 - 10 min walk to dam square.

Reviews.Title: “"Tatty old B&B" NOT 3* as advertised”
Reviews.Author: foxie894
Reviews.Content: My partner & I paid 420 euro to stay 3 night's in what I can only call a "shambles". Our room was so small only one of us could move around at a time whilst the other had to sit on the bed. The bathroom door only opened half as it jammed against the bed. The towel's in the bathroom were worn thin and stank. The whole interior of this place is ancient.... paint on wall's very dirty, carpets filthy and worn. Bed clothes were really old. When we booked, it advertised a bar......which they did have, only it was closed down. I wouldn't stay here again if it were "free". This is supposed to be a 3* hotel. In Ireland it would not even be rated as a B&B. Please do yourself a favour and stay in the Ibis next door. It is bright, clean and very friendly. I would give this hotel 2 out of 10 and that's just for location........nothing else!!

Reviews.Title: “Over Expensive Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So we went to Amsterdam. Not having thousands to spend, we found what we thought would be a good little joint (Pardon the pun!) to stay in for the week. The reviews had been mixed before we went but we thought that we should go for it! So we got there... got lost trying to find it, and on arrival a HUGE pile of rubbish bags and trash awaited us... as a refuge collection strike happened to be on at the time. Not their fault, but no attempt to hide it away or even sweep it out of the way, just left it in the path. When we entered, wasn't too fussed with the interior, seemed pretty o.k. based on the outside, got our room key from a women who didn't even know we were coming even though we pre-booked before.... Got to the room by using a rickety old lift that would be more suited to... well nothing, and was shocked at the state of the room compared to what we were paying. O.k, so we weren't expecting the hilton or anything, but the bathroom was dirty, bed was dirty, window was cracked and the wardrobe was kicked in and looked like it had been taped back together! Myself and brother were not going to pay Â£100.00 a night for this, so we (After reading GOOD reviews) decided to go next door (Like many others) to the hotel ibis. On route with our bags, a man who I can only guessed owned the place tried to rugby tackle my brother for walking out with the bags while I gave them the key back.... customer service at it's best!! Cutting a long story to a short end, we walked out - we were never charged a cancellation fee as they never took our bank details (haha!) and had a wonderful week in the Hotel Ibis. You live and you learn ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? Please... Stop trading!”
Reviews.Author: TJAbif
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this supposed hotel for two nights. It is DIRTY!! A Cesspool of filth, suffice to say it is a health hazard! The building is dated and hence the room! Feels like a shoe box to say the least! Went with my partner and it wasn't pretty sharing such a small room! Thought we'd at least have some view in our window... Ciggarette butts and spliff butts littered the window sill all along to the next room and the next room and so on... No complementary tea facilities in the room, bed linen dirty, towels threadbare and smelly. Lift broke down and there was hardly any communication between staff and guests; only a barely readable paper stuck on the lift door. Customer services for you! To top it all up; I felt like a real bozo for staying in this God forsaken place because good old hotel Ibis was just next door! Wouldn't recommend it for any one. I paid almost Â£350 for two nights and oh yes I am miffed by the service I got or in fact lack of it! Moreso, I am miffed by the fact that I have been misinformed by the hotel as to its standard and star ratings! It is not even worthy of hostel status!

Reviews.Title: “ICK.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Some positives about this hotel - restaurant and reception area were clean and modern. Close to downtown but there are lots of hotels close to downtown. Very close to the Hermitage Amsterdam and the Hortus and one of the outdoor markets. Room - not great, small, not much room to hang up clothes, bathroom never clean enough, shower head had amazing power which was great IF it stayed in the holder - when you turned up the water pressure full blast the shower head jumped off the holder and could kill someone, there was so much pressure. I'm sure it sounds like I'm exaggerating but I'm not - my husband has been telling stories aobut this since we've gotten back. Staff - mostly made us feel like we were a problem to deal with not people they would like to help. One good staff person was a young European man who was helpful when I needed to call my parents in North America and tell them we were OK and left London before the bombings. The rest of the staff at the desk really acted like they couldn't care less about us. I don't know what prices are in Amsterdam since this was our only hotel but surely there can be better hotels for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Noelsguitar
Reviews.Content: Come on, Instead of running this hotel into the ground, lets be honest, It was cheap. and if you pay for cheap, you get cheap. A group of eleven of us stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in May 2004. We wanted somewhere with a central location that was a reasonable price. That is exactly what the falcon plaza gave us. There were no frills. You got what you paid for. The rooms were basic, but clean, and breakfast plentiful. Don't come expecting the ritz because you will be disappointed. But good value for money is its selling point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Falcon Plaza may be an average hotel in appearance but the service given by the staff was well above average. The receptionist gave us great information as where to go and the best way to get there. The rest of the Hotel staff were very friendly and polite. would definately recommend it especially if your only using it to kip there on a night. We booked the quad room as we went with 2 kids. If travelling with kids this is definately a must as you dont get the usual rowdy crowd that come with the cheaper end of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an excellent weekend break in Amsterdam with my sister in law and two friends. I would rate this hotel as above average for what we paid to stay there. I don't know what some people expect for Â£34 per night - we were pleasantly surprised when this amount also included a continental breakfast. If you want 5* luxury, then you have to pay for it I am afraid! Check-in was excellent. We arrived about 3 hours earlier than we should have done at the hotel, but fortunately our room was ready for occupation, so the reception staff handed over the key and allowed us to deposit our luggage immediately. Our quad room was quite basic, but very clean and comfortable, and the bed linen was changed following each night of stay. There were also plenty of clean towels each day in the bathroom. The reception staff were very friendly and accommodating and spoke good English. The hotel was fairly centrally located (compared to some cities I have stayed in) and we did not feel at all wary walking around in a small group late at night. I would definitely stay in this hotel again should I return to Amsterdam in the future and would not hesitate in recommending it to my friends and family who were thinking of visiting this city.

HotelInfo.Name: Falcon Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Valkenburgerstraat 72, Amsterdam 1011 LZ, The Netherlands
